title: C&I and Utilities Storage Sales/Bid Team Internship
description: Start date: September 2024 Location: Amsterdam Duration: 6 months Time type: Full-time NOTE: YOU MUST BE ENROLLED IN EDUCATION DURING THE ENTIRE INTERNSHIP TO BE CONSIDERED. As a C&I and Utilities Storage Sales intern, your main job is to be responsible for the direct contact with our end customers to generate new orders and working closely with all the internal departments to ensure a great customer experience. You will also support our team of experienced account managers helping them on day-to-day activities with our customers. You will also coordinate the sharing of qualified leads with local Sales team and market partners. Via email, phone and Customer Relationship Management software, you will utilize a consistent contact process to follow-up and nurture leads with the purpose to assess the prospects' needs, while illustrating how our products can help them with their project. You will be able to educate customers on the benefits of Energy Storage, helping them to integrate more renewables.  In essence, with your motivation, passion and hard work you will help our customer joining and accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy. You will be involved in all size of battery energy storage project going from commercial size to GWhs Utility size projects and all over EMEA.

title: Supply Chain Planner Internship – Internal Import for Service
description: Location: Amsterdam, NL Working Hours: Full-Time Duration: 6 months Start date: September 2024 PLEASE NOTE YOU MUST BE ENROLLED IN EDUCATION FOR THE FULL DURATION OF THE INTERNSHIP TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE Tesla EMEA Service Internal Import team is responsible for parts managing the parts supply chain across regions (from NA and APAC towards EMEA). You will be mainly focusing on channel planning process and automation : supply planning, coordination with our supplier located in different time zone and internal logistics, solve day to day supply chain escalations but most importantly build business intelligence through analytics and process automation.

title: Finance Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
description: Location: Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg Duration: 6 months Time-type: full time Start date: asap The Finance Intern is responsible for complex daily work within a wide range of financial disciplines relating to production across the site. The intern supports day-to-day operations by performing SOX Controls and supporting education of operations; analysis of financial reports and investigation into anomalies; doing so by working closely with Analysts and Controllers to implement process improvement and automation. They will have exposure to a growing, highly experienced team, excited about the industry and our role within the new factory. This role will also focus on inventory projects.

title: OTC Accounting Internship
description: Location: Amsterdam Duration: 6 months   Time type: Full-time  Start date: September 2024 Please note that you have to be enrolled in your education throughout the whole internship period.   The OTC Accounting Internship offers you a great opportunity to be a part of global team operating in constantly changing environment to support daily operations of the Financial Department. Team members are expected not only to have skills to analyze data and surface takeaways but must also participate in cross-functional decision-making processes. As an OTC Accounting intern, you will be responsible for daily accounting transactions such as maintaining customers/partners outstanding balances, settlements of incoming payments, reconciliation of Ledger and Sub ledger accounts. Reporting directly to finance manager gives you an opportunity to participate in high-level meetings and observe how the company operates at a larger scale.

title: OTC Accounting Internship
description: Start date: September 2024 Duration: 6 months Location: Amsterdam Fulltime position (40hours a week) NOTE: YOU MUST BE ENROLLED IN EDUCATION DURING THE ENTIRE INTERNSHIP TO BE CONSIDERED The OTC Accounting Internship offers you a great opportunity to be a part of global team operating in constantly changing environment to support daily operations of the Finance Department. Team members are expected not only to have skills to analyse data and surface takeaways, but will also participate in cross-functional decision-making processes. As an OTC Accounting intern, you will be responsible for daily accounting transactions such as maintaining customer balances, reconciliation of balance sheet accounts and also to assist in financial analysis and enhance our financial and KPI reporting. You will work with an international team of analysts and accountants. You will work with an international team of analysts and accountants, who will involve you in topics which will enhance your skills and help you understand how the company operates on a larger scale.

title: Factory Planning, Layout Development Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
description: Looking for a highly motivated engineering intern to contribute towards the humungous task of Site and Factory Layout development and modeling through a detailed understanding of the factory objectives and extensive collaboration with internal and external teams. This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of the factory engineering team at Tesla’s world class manufacturing facility in Berlin-Brandenburg. Location: Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg Start date: as soon as possible, flexible start date

title: Supply Chain Internship - Raw Materials Procurement (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
description: Location: Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg Duration: 6 months Time Type: Full-time Start Date: September 2024 The Procurement team supports the development, implementation and management of strategies to provide Tesla with optimal supply assurance, pricing, flexibility, quality and delivery performance. Interns build and leverages strong working relationships with internal stakeholders and key suppliers to assure cost, quality, and delivery targets are met. Specific focus will involve a strong analysis support to define with the Supply Chain Managers a sharp negotiation strategy for 2025 Raw Material contracts, minimize costs of ownership and to achieve maximum advantage for Tesla and our customers.

title: Video Producer Internship
description: Locaion: Berlin, Germany Duration: 6 months Time type: Full-Time Start Date: September 2024 Our global Tesla Design Studio is on the lookout for a driven Video Producer intern. You'll be part of a multidiciplinary team based in Berlin, DE. As a Design Intern, you'll be responsible for both creative and logistical aspects of video projects covering the full range of Tesla products and innovations from automotive to energy and beyond. From Design studio, the customer experiences are conveived and crafted for both tactile and digital realms, encompassing our vehicle, energy, and charging programs. You will shape Tesla's external image through compelling visual narratives and creative content, all in support of our critical mission: Accelerating the World's Transition to Sustainable Energy.

description: At Tesla, our mission is to accelerate the transition to sustainable energy. Integrating Virtual Power Plants (VPPs) into energy networks is a crucial enabler of that mission.  The Tesla Energy team is seeking a Customer Experience Specialist to join the APAC Business Operations team. We are looking for an experienced and driven person who will be able to deliver an exceptional customer experience and support with the growth of Tesla’s VPP across Australia. PLEASE NOTE: We are only able to accomodate applicants who have the capacity to work 4.5 - 5 days a week. This is a 6 month internship opportunity.

title: Service Engineering Internship – Thermal diagnostic software routines
description: Location: Amsterdam Duration: 6 months Start date: September 2024 Length: Fulltime (40h a week) NOTE: YOU MUST BE ENROLLED IN EDUCATION DURING THE ENTIRE INTERNSHIP TO BE CONSIDERED. You will be part of EMEA Service Engineering. Service Engineering works to ensure that delivered vehicles operate as intended and can be repaired effectively. This is accomplished by working closely with Vehicle Service as well as engineering departments within Tesla. Service Engineering conducts root cause analysis when the failure reason is unknown or new, analyze data on vehicle or fleet level to identify issues or track trends, and develop repair and diagnostic procedures allowing vehicle technicians to repair vehicles effectively and efficiently.

title: Field Operations Internship
description: Location: Amsterdam Duration: 6 months  Time type: Full-time Start date: September 2024 Please note that you have to be enrolled in your education throughout the whole internship period Tesla develops high-performance electric vehicles, battery energy storage systems, solar systems and charging infrastructure. The focus is to reduce the environmental impact of transportation and electric energy use by accelerating the adoption of electric vehicle, energy storage, and solar technologies. The EMEA Tesla energy & charging service team is critical to this mission, and as a member of our team, you will help to maintain the fleet to ensure an excellent customer experience and best-in-class availability. You must have a genuine passion for technology and a bias towards solving challenges that will fundamentally change the world’s energy and EV charging infrastructure. You must want to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment with a high degree of self-sufficiency. Integrated within the Field operations team, you will be embedded in the daily operations, supporting both near-term execution and long-term planning. Team members are expected to partner closely with the business to develop reporting tools, improve processes, analyze technical data, provide recommendations, lead cross-functional decision-making and implementation of large-scale change for how Tesla Energy operates its 10-30 year warrantied assets. You will additionally also have end-to-end ownership of data analytics projects related to tracking successful delivery of our contractual obligations, automating the required analysis to ensure compliance across the fleet and improving the existing code base to ensure scalability and reliability of the data for decision making and process improvements. You will execute on all aspects of the project, i.e. those involving review of contracts and ticket system data, as well as those involving scripting and database management.

title: Software Engineering Internship - Service Engineering
description: Location: Amsterdam Duration: 6 months Start date: September 2024 Length: Fulltime (40h a week) NOTE: YOU MUST BE ENROLLED IN EDUCATION DURING THE ENTIRE INTERNSHIP TO BE CONSIDERED. We are looking for a highly motivated Software Engineering Intern to join our EMEA Service Engineering team. You will design and develop innovative software and diagnostic user interfaces to improve the insights of service technicians into the health of serviced vehicles. Your code will have a lot of impact and travel within all Tesla vehicles worldwide!  The ideal candidate for this role possesses very strong coding skills (focus on front-end but ability to dive into back-end topics as well), likes to tinker and experiment with personal projects (please highlight those in your CV), and is comfortable navigating complex interconnected systems.

title: Sales & Service Finance Internship
description: Start date: September 2024 Location: Amsterdam Duration: 6 months Time type: Full-time Please note that you have to be enrolled in your education throughout the whole internship period The Team Tesla Finance combines traditional financial planning and analysis with broader business decision-making and strategy. Finance is embedded in daily operations, supporting both near-term execution and long-term planning. Team members are expected to analyze data, provide recommendations, and lead cross-functional decision-making and implementation of the recommendations with the relevant executives/teams throughout the company. Through the intern program, we are looking to find the next wave of talent to drive these efforts. Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) works with our Finance and Accounting leadership team and other subgroups to: Lead Tesla’s P&L, balance sheet and cash flow forecast process, including reviewing with Tesla’s Leadership and Board of Directors and working with finance and non-finance stakeholders to analyze the impact of proposed business decisions Develop and track cross-company efforts to improve gross margin and cash flow Lead long term planning for Tesla, including new products/capabilities, and capital need Sales, Marketing and Service (SMS) Finance works with the Sales, Service and Marketing teams to:  Manage investments into SMS activities Develop associated forecasts, and lead profitability analysis/improvement initiatives at the global and regional level Lead pricing efforts, including options and services, and business planning for retail, service and sales enablement Develop and evaluate ROI for new markets, new business models, used vehicles, and service

Our year-round program places the best students in positions where they will grow technically, professionally, and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. The Vehicle Human Factors and Ergonomics team is looking for a talented and motivated engineering student to join us at the Tesla Design Studio. This role offers a rare opportunity to work on a team that handles ownership and development of new and genuinely cutting-edge vehicles. Enthusiasm and knowledge of cars is advantageous, and you must have a genuine passion for engineering the world’s best electric vehicles.

title: Direct Procurement Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
description: Tesla is seeking an intern to work directly for the Giga Berlin Direct Purchasing Team. The intern will assist this team in all the direct purchasing related activities.  This includes working with our GSM (Global Supply Manager) counterparts in the US to align on global strategy, and ensure local strategy is in line with global strategy. Complete supplier nomination by looking at total landed cost, while ensuring high quality and having the ability to be comfortable in a dynamic, ever-changing environment, is key. The intern will interact with the global team in EU, US and China in order to understand the global strategy and bring value.   The intern will learn to create suppliers in our system, purchase orders, and make sure that the purchasing process is as smooth as possible The Purchasing team offers the interns an opportunity to develop themselves in an international corporation with both operational and project work during the assignment. Location: Gigafactory Grunheide Duration: 6 months  Time type: Full Time  Start date: July/August 2024

About the Team We are looking for a highly motivated student with a strong interest in security to work on Tesla products and future R&D projects. Other car companies have talked for years about a future of "connected cars." At Tesla, we make it happen. We regularly send over-the-air software updates to our fleet, seamlessly delivering new features and improvements to our customers. Our mobile applications allow customers to interact with their cars via real-time, low-latency two-way communication. We also build tools for our internal sales, delivery, and service teams. Today we remotely identify potential vehicle issues before a customer does—and often fix problems remotely too. To this end information and product security is of the utmost importance. As a Product Security Engineering Intern, you will be expected to analyze system services, operating systems, networks and applications from a security perspective. You will be involved in discovering security issues and recommending patches. You will participate in security audits, risk analysis, vulnerability testing and security reviews.

title: Battery Engineering, Mechanical Design Engineer, Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
description: Tesla is seeking highly motivated engineering students who thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to apply mechanical concepts to real world projects. Our team drives collaboration with many engineering groups— team players only. Tesla moves quickly, so being self-motivated and disciplined is critical. You must be passionate, but direction changes quickly, so you must also be resilient. As an intern you will work directly with full-time engineers to design, prototype, test and launch new parts and processes to improve our batteries. Every day we push the boundaries of what is possible for energy storage in our vehicles, demanding extreme attention to details and the highest standard of performance, quality and manufacturability.

title: Internship, Rendering Engineer, Simulation
description: Autopilot is of critical importance to Tesla's mission. It is safer, makes driving more enjoyable, and will ultimately deliver on the promise of self-driving cars. As a member of Tesla's Autopilot Simulation team, you will be in a unique position to accelerate the pace at which Autopilot improves over time. The main ways in which the simulation team realizes this is through building tools that enable Autopilot Software Developers to perform virtual test drives instead of real ones, testing all Autopilot software releases for regressive behavior and generating synthetic data sets for neural network training.     The foundation on which we build these elements is our simulation environment. We develop photorealistic worlds for our virtual car to drive in, enabling our developers to iterate faster and rely less on real-world testing. We strive for perfect correlation to real-world vehicle behavior and work with Autopilot Software Engineers to improve both Autopilot and the simulator over time. Our group is a cross-disciplinary team with people from various backgrounds and fields of expertise, like CS generalists, mechanical engineers, game developers, and computer graphics artists. As a member on this team, you will be challenged to learn about all these different disciplines and use your own expertise to further improve the scope and usability of our tools.    As an Autopilot Rendering Intern, you will contribute to the development of Autopilot simulation by enabling and supporting the creation of photo realistic 3D scenes that can accurately model the driving experience in a wide range of locales and conditions.

title: Product Engineering Internship, Industrial Energy Products
description: Location: Amsterdam, the Netherlands  Duration: 6 Months  Start date: September 2024  Length: Fulltime (40h a week)  Please note: In order to be considered, you must be enrolled in education for the full duration of the internship.  The Tesla Energy Product and Service Engineering team is looking for a passionate, collaborative, and skilled Product Engineering Intern to join the global team to support the explosive growth of our Industrial Storage fleet. As the Industrial Storage fleet grows, Tesla is also committed to having an industry-leading uptime in our deployed fleet of commercial and utility scale batteries.  We use data collected from our highly connected systems to find problems before the customer does and to systematically eliminate the causes of downtime. The Industrial Storage team is seeking a product engineering intern to support the identification and root cause of design, process, firmware and software failures in our fleet of energy storage systems.  You will work with a team of engineers to diagnose why the power converters, battery modules, digital control systems, heating and cooling systems in Tesla’s industrial batteries occasionally malfunction. To be successful, in this role you will need to be skilled at troubleshooting electronic systems, mechanical systems, and computer networks in person and remotely.  You should be comfortable developing your own code, manipulating SQL data, and working in the lab.  If you are a “maker” that loves to solve problems, this is the internship for you.

title: High Voltage Distribution, Mechanical Design Engineer, Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
description: Location: Gigafactory Grunheide Duration: 6 months  Time type: Full Time Start date: October 2024 Mechanical engineers within the High Voltage Distribution team routinely tackle extremely difficult engineering challenges and continuously push beyond what was deemed impossible in regards to mechanical packaging, electrical and thermal performance, cost, and delivery timelines. Our teams operate with a non-conventional automotive product development philosophy of high inter-disciplinary collaboration, flat organizational structure, and technical contribution at all levels. You would be expected to challenge and to be challenged, to create, to innovate. Being working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company should be a pleasure for you. We are building real products. This should excite you. You would work alongside exceptionally motivated engineers in a fast and rapidly changing environment. You are obliged to determine to make your designs successful and excited to engineer the best electric vehicles in the world.

title: Manufacturing Development Program
description: As an apprentice of the Manufacturing Development Program (MDP), you will be trained on how to build the batteries and drive units that power the most exciting, environmentally friendly vehicles on the planet, while expanding your knowledge in the growing field of Advanced Manufacturing. Program participants will complete a rigorous 4–6-week scholarship in Advanced Manufacturing, apply skills as a Production Associate at Gigafactory Nevada following course completion, and earn a Production Operator Certification after 2000 hours of on the job learning. We are looking for a new group of indiviuals to help us build a more sustainable future. If you are interested in jumpstarting a career in Manufacturing, we want to hear from you.

title: Internship, AI Engineer, Self-Driving (Fall 2024)
description: Tesla is seeking exceptional Machine Learning Interns to help build large scale models to drive the future of autonomy across all current and future generations of Tesla AI products. You will work on a lean team without boundaries and have access to one of the world’s largest training clusters with a data engine that constantly generates new information for improving our models. Most importantly, you will see your work repeatedly shipped to and utilized by millions of Tesla’s customers.  We are seeking Interns in the following AI disciplines:  Train large-scale foundation and generative models that are optimized for performance and latency  Improve data engine for large scale and high-quality dataset curation Reinforcement Learning for instilling objectives and improving overall robustness Design compound AI systems for better planning and reasoning

title: Service Engineering Internship – Low Voltage Diagnostic Software
description: Location: Tilburg Duration: 6 months Start date: September 2024 Length: Fulltime (40h a week) NOTE: YOU MUST BE ENROLLED IN HIGHER EDUCATION DURING THE ENTIRE INTERNSHIP TO BE CONSIDERED. Join our Service Engineering department and help us optimize the repair process for Tesla vehicles. As an intern, you will play a role in our mission to ensure efficent vehicle diagnois and repair processes by collaborating closely with both Vehicle Service and various engineering departments within Tesla.  During this internship, you will deep dive into Tesla’s technology, focusing specifically on the development and validation of diagnosis automation for our Low Voltage subsystems.  Your responsabilities will include:  Conducting in-depth root cause analysis of component-specific failure modes affecting our global fleet Leveraging vehicle data logs to identify unique failure mode signatures Designing, developing and validating software solutions to automate diagnosis and streamline vehicle repair Reviewing and improving vehicle calibration and configuration software routines Developing knowledge on vehicle low voltage systems, including electro-mechanical systems and communication protocols

As a Mechanical Engineer Intern on Tesla’s Service Collision Development team you will be responsible for specifying and designing Structural Repair Procedures used to service Tesla electric vehicles world-wide. You will work with internal customers to identify and develop practical solutions to enable fast, seamless, and revolutionary service. The ideal candidate is someone who gets excited solving a variety of problems, competent building things, highly analytical, and sees the big picture needed to evolve a concept into a product. The ideal candidate is a mechanical engineer and possesses a strong understanding of manufacturing concepts. If you’re someone who’s creative, engaging and driven, and you’re interested in becoming a part of a world-class team supporting Tesla’s mission through the service and continued support of our customers and collision shops in the field, we are interested in hearing from you.

title: Duales Studium Maschinenbau (B.Sc.) (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
description: Als Student/in im Maschinenbau lernst du unterschiedliche mechanische, mechatronische und elektronische Geräte bis hin zu komplexen Produktionsanlagen kennen. Von Idee und Entwurf über Design und Konstruktion bis hin zu Optimierung und Entwicklung einer Anlage bringst du deine Ideen ein.  In deinem Studium wechseln sich Hochschul- und Praxisphasen regelmäßig ab, so dass du die Theorie direkt in der Praxis kennenlernst. Bei unserem Hochschulpartner, der HTW – Hochschule für Technik und Wirtschaft Berlin, werden die theoretischen Inhalte des Studiengangs vermittelt. Die vorlesungsfreien Zeiten, Praxisphasen, verbringst du bei uns in der Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg und wirst Teil eines Teams unserer Fahrzeug- oder Batteriezellenfertigung.  Start des Studiums: 01. September 2024  Studiendauer 3 Jahre  Dich erwarten: spannende und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben  motiviertes und internationales Team  modernes Arbeitsumfeld Möglichkeiten zur Weiterbildung und hervorragende Karrierechancen 30 Tage Urlaub sehr gute Ausbildungsvergütung  attraktives Tesla Aktien-Paket
